comments_since_last_sample.body: I always respond to that question: Yes, you could ask to one of your peers for the class notes. I wouldn't say it feels insulting but you sure won't be making extra points for participation in class.

top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Yes, and its easy to think "oh but look it shows I'm responsible and I care," no, it doesn't. It shows that only sometimes you think the class is important and that they have nothing else better to do but to answer your tiny email. You aren't their only student nor their only class, your professor is not your messenger boy.

Real lpt… when you miss class, check the syllabus for what lecture was scheduled that day. Skim the the book/ask a friend for the notes until you find something you genuinely don’t understand. Ask the professor about it during office hours or next class

I’m a college professor and this is 100% spot on. 
When students ask this I just say no. “Important” is subjective.

Better phrase: "what did I miss in class today? sorry I was not able to make it."
The teacher will most definitely tell you what you missed because what they taught is important . . . Aka . . . Class is important
